findings.title: Owner privileges
findings.description: The owner has excessive privileges to change various parameters and settings, including tax and liquidity fee, maximum transaction amount, rewardDivisor, minimum number of tokens to add to liquidity, buyBackUpperLimit, reward address, and enable/disable buyBack and presale modes.

findings.title: Race conditions and Reentrancy. Cross-function race conditions.
findings.description: Cross-function race conditions can lead to reentrancy attacks, causing unintended behavior and potential security risks.

findings.title: DoS with Revert.
findings.description: The function may be aborted with an OUT_OF_GAS exception if there will be a long excluded addresses list due to loops in includeInReward() and _getCurrentSupply functions.

findings.title: DoS with block gas limit.
findings.description: The contract may be vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) attacks due to the block gas limit, which can cause transactions to fail or be aborted with OUT_OF_GAS exceptions if there are long lists or loops.

findings.title: Methods execution permissions.
findings.description: The audit report does not provide a detailed description of this finding.

findings.title: Economy model of the contract.
findings.description: The economy model of the contract has a low severity issue where half of the liquidity goes to the reward address.

findings.title: The impact of the exchange rate on the logic.
Uninitialized storage pointers.
findings.description: The audit report does not provide a detailed description of this finding.

findings.title: Safe Open Zeppelin contracts implementation and usage.
findings.description: The implementation and usage of Open Zeppelin contracts are safe.

findings.title: Out of gas
findings.description: The functions includeInReward() and _getCurrentSupply() may cause an OUT_OF_GAS exception if there is a long excluded addresses list.
